user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_dir_rewind:
```c
int lfs_dir_rewind(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_dir_t *dir) {
    int err = LFS_LOCK(lfs->cfg);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }
    LFS_TRACE("lfs_dir_rewind(%p, %p)", (void*)lfs, (void*)dir);

    err = lfs_dir_rewind_(lfs, dir);

    LFS_TRACE("lfs_dir_rewind -> %d", err);
    LFS_UNLOCK(lfs->cfg);
    return err;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function lfs_dir_rewind:
#define LFS_LOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg,0)
...
#define LFS_UNLOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg)
...
#define LFS_TRACE(__VA_ARGS__) 
...
static int lfs_dir_rewind_(lfs_t *lfs, lfs_dir_t *dir) {
    // reload the head dir
    int err = lfs_dir_fetch(lfs, &dir->m, dir->head);
    if (err) {
        return err;
    }

    dir->id = 0;
    dir->pos = 0;
    return 0;
}
...
static int lfs_dir_fetch(lfs_t *lfs,
        lfs_mdir_t *dir, const lfs_block_t pair[2]) {
    // note, mask=-1, tag=-1 can never match a tag since this
    // pattern has the invalid bit set
    return (int)lfs_dir_fetchmatch(lfs, dir, pair,
            (lfs_tag_t)-1, (lfs_tag_t)-1, NULL, NULL, NULL);
}
...
typedef struct lfs {
    lfs_cache_t rcache;
    lfs_cache_t pcache;

    lfs_block_t root[2];
    struct lfs_mlist {
        struct lfs_mlist *next;
        uint16_t id;
        uint8_t type;
        lfs_mdir_t m;
    } *mlist;
    uint32_t seed;

    lfs_gstate_t gstate;
    lfs_gstate_t gdisk;
    lfs_gstate_t gdelta;

    struct lfs_lookahead {
        lfs_block_t start;
        lfs_block_t size;
        lfs_block_t next;
        lfs_block_t ckpoint;
        uint8_t *buffer;
    } lookahead;

    const struct lfs_config *cfg;
    lfs_size_t block_count;
    lfs_size_t name_max;
    lfs_size_t file_max;
    lfs_size_t attr_max;
    lfs_size_t inline_max;

#ifdef LFS_MIGRATE
    struct lfs1 *lfs1;
#endif
} lfs_t
...
typedef struct lfs_dir {
    struct lfs_dir *next;
    uint16_t id;
    uint8_t type;
    lfs_mdir_t m;

    lfs_off_t pos;
    lfs_block_t head[2];
} lfs_dir_t
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation:
I inspected the provided code and related macros/types for use of compiler-specific language extensions. I found no such extensions. Specific points checked: 
- LFS_TRACE(__VA_ARGS__) uses a variadic macro, which is standard since C99 (not a compiler-specific extension). The macro is defined empty in this build; invoking it with arguments is valid under standard C99+ macro semantics.
- LFS_LOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg,0) and LFS_UNLOCK(cfg) ((void)cfg) use the comma operator and explicit void casts—both standard C.
- Casts such as (void*)lfs and (lfs_tag_t)-1 are standard C casts.
- Function parameter array notation (const lfs_block_t pair[2]) and nested struct declarations are standard C syntax.
- Use of // comments, fixed-width integer types (uint8_t, uint16_t, uint32_t), and conditional #ifdef are all standard language or library features.
- No occurrences of known compiler extensions were found (e.g., __attribute__, __builtin_*, typeof, statement-expressions ({ ... }), nested functions, inline assembly, or vendor-specific pragmas/macros).

Therefore there are no code fragments that need to be investigated for MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 in the supplied code.
